Description: Wall fragment from a table ware pottery vessel, probably a closed form. Medium-fine, reddish yellow (7.5 YR 7/6) clay. Smooth red slip (10 R 5/8) coating. Eastern Terra Sigillata ware .
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Described as 'Pergamon ware' (Piekarski 2001, 55 no. D 34 pl. 26.3).
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 55, no. D34, pl. 26, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IF.078)
